text: is there a way to download lists in HubSpot in bulk? there's around 300 lists which will take a hell lot of time to download manually.
Seems redundant to have “Slack” in the logo.

Hi :wave::skin-tone-2:.  I’m <@U0190968M6H>, Senior Product Designer of CMS Developer Experience at HubSpot. I am working with <@U0163CK2J20> who is also on the DevEx team and we are hoping to get some feedback on serverless functions.  If you’re holding back from using this feature, could you drop a quick note in the thread below and tell us why in a few sentences? Thanks! :pray::skin-tone-2:
that doesn't seem to be working

What you could do is create an empty array of “blogs_to_include” then inside of your current for loop create an additional variable that is an object `{% set trigger = {"featured": false} %}`     and then while youre looping through the tags if the tag = featured reset that trigger to true `{% set test = trigger.update({'featured': true})` and finally on the last loop check to see if featured is checked and if it is then append the post to the new blogs_to_include array.
Then you build your listing using that blogs_to_include array
thanks <@UQWGKUEN7> - let me give that a try
working on it now <@UQWGKUEN7> - will let you know if it works... thanks again for the support
I thought the same thing at first, but those header elements are on every page. Google Search Console only flagged the About page.
